alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 30 at 7:45PM MST until June 30 at 10:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Gila County near Payson in east central Arizona... * Until 1045 PM MST. * At 743 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain from Payson to Star Valley. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... east side of Payson, Star Valley and Round Valley. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 253 and 258. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Dry Pocket Wash, Green Valley Creek, Sand Wash, Houston Creek, Pyeatt Draw, Saint Johns Creek, Tonto Creek and Gibson Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
